result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard A. Erwin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $100.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Huber Privileges and Good Time Credit granted.
Concurrent with: Waushara Co Case No. 2016CM000116
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard A. Erwin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 16CM-76 and 16CM-116 - Both Cases Called @ 1:49 PM: Defendant Richard A. Erwin in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both Complaints Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not wish counsel today and is prepared to resolve the matters today.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. 16CM-116:  ADA will move for dismissal of Ct 2 FTI IID.  16CM-76 Plea:  GP  16CM-116 Ct 1 OAR 2 Plea:  NC  Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.   Factual basis to accept pleas.  Ct 2 of 16CM-116 DRI.  ADA argues for slight jail sentence with costs.  Statement offered by Def as to nature of driving.  The Court:  Imposes 10 days WCJ with concurrent terms as to each count. Huber and GT with no TS credit; Report 5/1/16 at 8:00 PM and Court Costs plus DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Bond to be applied with 60 DTP or PP.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights given.  ID required if necessary - if cannot be duplicated.
